intro: [WRONG START] Walenia subverticillata, commonly known as the false lily of the valley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, forming dense mats along the ground. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
